snippet: The case has drawn criticism from human rights groups who accused the government of using the trial to warn other people against expressing dissent.
abstract: Turkey's justice system puts on trial 35 members of a soccer fan club who took part in 2013 demonstrations in Istanbul on charges of attempting to overthrow the government; Human Rights Watch and other groups condemn move by government, which they charge is effort to clamp down any further opposition.
lead_paragraph: The case has drawn criticism from human rights groups who accused the government of using the trial to warn other people against expressing dissent.

headline.main: Soccer Fans in Turkish Protests Stand Trial
headline.print_headline: Turkish Soccer Fans Stand Trial Over Protests

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
